intro: Kibatalia macrophylla, commonly known as the giant kibatalia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and produces yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are woody, spherical drupes that contain a single seed. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
